algorithms.name: clear impressions for a conversion site
algorithms.html: To clear impressions for a conversion site, given an origin origin, run these steps:

steps.html: If origin is not a tuple origin with a scheme of https, return.
Let site be the value returned by invoking obtain a registrable domain, passing the host part of the origin tuple.
For each impression impression of the impression store:
If impression has an Intermediary Site equal to site, remove impression from the impression store and continue.
If impression has a Conversion Sites set that does not contain the value site, continue.
If the size of impression’s Conversion Sites is greater than one, remove site from impression’s Conversion Sites and continue.
Otherwise, remove impression from the impression store.

algorithms.name: parse a site
algorithms.html: To parse a site, returning either site or failure, given a string input, run these steps:

steps.html: Let host be the value returned by invoking host parser, passing input.
If host is failure, return failure.
Let site be the value returned by obtain a registrable domain, passing host.
If site is null, return failure.
Return a scheme-and-host tuple of ("https", site).

algorithms.name: deduct privacy budget
algorithms.html: To deduct privacy budget given a privacy budget key key, double epsilon, integer sensitivity, and integer globalSensitivity:

steps.html: If the privacy budget store does not contain key, set its value of key to be a user agent-defined value, plus 1000.
Let currentValue be the result of getting the value of key in the privacy budget store.
Let deductionFp be epsilon * sensitivity / globalSensitivity.
If deductionFp is negative or greater than 4294, set the value of key in the privacy budget store to 0 and return false.
Let deduction be deductionFp * 1000000, rounded towards positive Infinity.
If deduction is greater than currentValue, set the value of key in the privacy budget store to 0 and return false.
Set the value of key in the privacy budget store to currentValue − deduction and return true.

algorithms.name: get the current epoch
algorithms.html: To get the current epoch given a site site, and moment t, returning an epoch index:

steps.html: Let period be the duration of one epoch.
If the epoch start store does not contain site, set its value to t, minus a duration that is randomly selected from between 0 (inclusive) and period (exclusive).
Let start be the result of getting the value of site from the epoch start store.
Let elapsed be (t - start) / period.
Return elapsed as an integer, rounded towards negative Infinity.

algorithms.name: get the starting epoch for attribution
algorithms.html: To get the starting epoch for attribution given site site, returning an epoch index:

steps.html: Let startEpoch be a user agent-defined value for the earliest epoch index that is supported for attribution.
If the last browsing history clear is set, perform the following steps:
Let clearEpoch be the result of get the current epoch with site and the value of last browsing history clear.
Set clearEpoch to clearEpoch + 2.
If clearEpoch is greater than startEpoch, return clearEpoch.
Return startEpoch.

algorithms.name: PrivateAttribution/saveImpression(options)
algorithms.html:
The saveImpression(options) method steps are:

saveImpression() does not return a status indicating whether the impression was recorded. This minimizes the ability to detect when the Private Attribution API is disabled. Similarly, resolution of the returned promise is not predicated on saving impression to the impression store in order to avoid timing side channels related to the number of existing impressions and whether the API is enabled.

steps.html: Let realm be this’s relevant realm.

If this’s relevant global object’s associated Document is not allowed to use the policy-controlled feature named "save-impression", return a promise rejected with a "NotAllowedError" DOMException in realm.
Let settings be this’s relevant settings object.
Collect the implicit API inputs from <var>settings</var>:
Let timestamp be settings’ current wall time.
The impression site site is set to the result of obtaining a site from the top-level origin.
The intermediary site intermediarySite is set to
a value of undefined if the origin is same site with the top-level origin,
otherwise, the result of obtaining a site from settings’ origin.
Validate the page-supplied API inputs:
If options.lifetimeDays is 0, return a promise rejected with a RangeError in realm.
Clamp options.lifetimeDays to the user agent’s upper limit.
If the size of options.conversionSites is greater than an implementation-defined maximum value, throw a RangeError.
Let conversionSites be the set that is the result of invoking parse a site for each value in options.conversionSites.
If any result in conversionSites is failure, return a promise rejected with a "SyntaxError" DOMException in realm.
Run the following steps in parallel:

Construct impression as a saved impression comprising:

Match Value

options.matchValue

Impression Site

site

Intermediary Site

intermediarySite

Conversion Sites

conversionSites

Timestamp

timestamp

Lifetime

options.lifetimeDays, multiplied by a duration of one day

Histogram Index

options.histogramIndex
If the Private Attribution API is enabled, save impression to the impression store.
Let result be a new PrivateAttributionImpressionResult.
Return a promise resolved with result in realm.

algorithms.name: PrivateAttribution/measureConversion(options)
algorithms.html: The measureConversion(options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let realm be this’s relevant realm.

If this’s relevant global object’s associated Document is not allowed to use the policy-controlled feature named "measure-conversion", return a promise rejected with a "NotAllowedError" DOMException in realm.
Let settings be this’s relevant settings object.
Collect the implicit API inputs from <var>settings</var>:
Let now be settings’ current wall time.
Let topLevelSite (the conversion site) be the result of obtaining a site from the top-level origin.
The intermediary site is set to
a value of undefined if the origin is same site with the top-level origin,
otherwise, the result of obtaining a site from settings’ origin.
Let validatedOptions be the result of validating options, returning a promise rejected with any thrown reason.
Let promise be a new promise in realm.
Run the following steps in parallel:
Let report be the result of invoking create an all-zero histogram with validatedOptions’ histogram size.
If the Private Attribution API is enabled, set report to the result of do attribution and fill a histogram with validatedOptions, topLevelSite, and now.
Let encryptedReport be the result of encrypting report.

Let result be a PrivateAttributionConversionResult with the following items:

report

encryptedReport
Queue a task on the Private Attribution task source to resolve promise with result.
Return promise.

algorithms.name: validate PrivateAttributionConversionOptions
algorithms.html: To validate PrivateAttributionConversionOptions options:

steps.html: If aggregationServices does not contain an entry with a key of options.aggregationService, throw a ReferenceError.
If options.epsilon is less than or equal to 0 or is greater than 4294, throw a RangeError.
If options.histogramSize is 0 or greater than an implementation-defined maximum value, throw a RangeError.
Switch on the value of options.logic:
Perform the following steps:
If options.value is 0, throw a RangeError.
If options.value is greater than options.maxValue, throw a RangeError.
Let lookback be options.lookbackDays days if it exists, the implementation-defined maximum otherwise.
If lookback is 0 days, throw a RangeError.
Let matchValue be the result of running creating a set with options.matchValue.
Let impressionSites be the set that is the result of invoking parse a site for each value in options.impressionSites.
If any result in impressionSites is failure, throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.
Let intermediarySites be the set that is the result of invoking parse a site for each value in options.intermediarySites.
If any result in intermediarySites is failure, throw a "SyntaxError" DOMException.

Return a validated conversion options with the following fields:

Aggregation Service

options.aggregationService

Epsilon

options.epsilon

Histogram Size

options.histogramSize

Lookback

lookback

Match Value

matchValue

Impression Sites

impressionSites

Intermediary Sites

intermediarySites

Logic

options.logic

Value

options.value

Max Value

options.maxValue

algorithms.name: do attribution and fill a histogram
algorithms.html: To do attribution and fill a histogram, given validated conversion options options, site topLevelSite, and moment now:

steps.html: Let matchedImpressions be an empty set.
Let currentEpoch be the result of get the current epoch with topLevelSite and now.
Let startEpoch be the result of get the starting epoch for attribution with topLevelSite.
For each <var>epoch</var> from <var>startEpoch</var> to <var>currentEpoch</var>, inclusive:
Let impressions be the result of invoking common matching logic with options, topLevelSite, epoch, and now.
If impressions is not empty:
Let key be a privacy budget key whose items are epoch and topLevelSite.
Let budgetOk be the result of deduct privacy budget with key, options’ epsilon, options’ value, and options’s max value.
If budgetOk is true, extend matchedImpressions with impressions.
If matchedImpressions is empty, return the result of invoking create an all-zero histogram with options’ histogram size.
Switch on options’ logic:
Return the result of fill a histogram with last-touch attribution with matchedImpressions, options’ histogram size, and options’ value.

algorithms.name: create an all-zero histogram
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-an-all-zero-histogram" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create an all-zero histogram</dfn>, given an integer <var>size</var>:

steps.html: Return a list of size size, whose items are all 0.

algorithms.name: common matching logic
algorithms.html: To perform common matching logic, given validated conversion options options, site topLevelSite, epoch index epoch, and moment now:

steps.html: Let matching be an empty set.
If the number of days since the end of epoch exceeds options’ lookback, return matching.
For each impression in the impression store for the epoch:
If now is after impression’s timestamp plus impression’s lifetime, continue.
If now - options’ lookback is after impression’s timestamp, continue.
If impression’s conversion sites is not empty and does not contain topLevelSite, continue.
If options’ match value is not empty and does not contain impression’s match value, continue.
If options’ impression sites is not empty and does not contain impression’s impression site, continue.
Append impression to matching.
Return matching.

algorithms.name: fill a histogram with last-touch attribution
algorithms.html: To fill a histogram with last-touch attribution, given a set of impressions matchedImpressions, an integer histogramSize, and an integer value:

steps.html: Assert: matchedImpressions is not empty.
Let impression be the value in matchedImpressions with the most recent timestamp.
Let histogram be the result of invoking create an all-zero histogram with histogramSize.
Let index be impression’s histogram index.
If index is less than histogram’s size, set histogram[index] to value.
Return histogram.

algorithms.name: parse a Save-Impression header
algorithms.html: To parse a Save-Impression header given a header value input, run these steps:

steps.html: Let dict be the result of parsing structured fields with input_bytes set to input and field_type set to "dictionary".
If parsing failed, return an error.
If dict["histogram-index"] does not exist or is not an integer or is less than 0, return an error.
Let histogramIndex be dict["histogram-index"].
Let conversionSites be dict["conversion-sites"] with default an empty inner list.
If any of conversionSites’ items is not a string, return an error.
Let matchValue be dict["match-value"] with default 0.
If matchValue is not an integer or is less than 0, return an error.
Let lifetimeDays be dict["lifetime-days"] with default 30.
If lifetimeDays is not an integer or is less than or equal to 0, return an error.

Return a new PrivateAttributionImpressionOptions with the following items:

histogramIndex

histogramIndex

matchValue

matchValue

conversionSites

conversionSites

lifetimeDays

lifetimeDays
